response.answer_text: Diagnostic medical equipment are those that are used to diagnose diseases or medical problems in patient. A typical diagnostic centre/ set-up usually includes Clinical Lab and Imaging equipment. A medical laboratory or clinical laboratory is a laboratory where tests are done on clinical specimens (such blood, urine, stool, semen, bone-marrow and several other body fluids) in order to obtain information about the health of a patient for diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease. A basic clinical laboratory includes equipment like ABG machine / Blood gas analyzer, Cell counter / Hematology analyser, Bio-chemistry analyser, Electrolyte Analyzer, Urine analyzer, ESR Analyzer etc. Equipment for imaging include X-Ray, CR System, Ultrasound, CT, MRI, Bone-densitometer, mammograph etc. Diagnostic imaging equipment typically constitute 30% of overall medical equipment market, while laboratory equipment, also called IV diagnostic equipment constitute another 10% of the overall medical equipment market.
